# Coresets for KMeans (Practical)

Let us import some packages first,

```{python include=FALSE}
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
from sklearn.datasets import make_blobs
from scipy.spatial.distance import cdist, pdist
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
```
```py
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
from sklearn.datasets import make_blobs
from scipy.spatial.distance import cdist, pdist
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
```
## Pseudo-data with 4 clusters

Now, we generate a dataset with 4 clusters.
```{python}
c4X, c4y = make_blobs(n_samples=100, centers=4, n_features=2, random_state=0, cluster_std=0.7)
plt.figure(figsize=(3,2))
plt.scatter(c4X[:,0], c4X[:,1], c=c4y, s=10)
plt.title('c4 pseudo-data');
```
